page.title: 04LOCAL INDUSTRY- 2
page.content: {FITTED KITCHEN FURNITURE-}This is a 2-man business.The men who run it have only been in business for 5 weeks. Previously they were redundant from a similar firm.They use a new material called chipboard covered in "melamine" (a hard plastic available in many colours).Chipboard is high density compressed wood chippings and glue.The units are made complete in the workshop and fitted into the home. {THE FABRICATING COMPANY}employs 3 people.Most of the jobs involve welding which requires special training.Products include steel narrowboats,sheet metal farm trailers and fibre glass sailing dinghies.After the 1982 recession work is just beginning to increase.The working week is 45 hours and it is difficult to find skilled welders who will accept the other work associated with it.
